meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the photosphere.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the photospheric layer of the sun to understand its brightness.
meanings.sent2: The photospheric glow of the star was mesmerizing to the observers.
meanings.sent3: The photospheric light made the sun look like a giant glowing ball in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as warm and photospheric as the morning sun.
meanings.sent5: The photospheric aura around the star was visible through the telescope.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the outermost layer of a star, especially the sun.
meanings.sent1: The photospheric layer of the sun is where solar flares originate.
meanings.sent2: Astronomers study the photospheric activity to predict solar storms.
meanings.sent3: The photospheric region of the sun is like its protective outer shell.
meanings.sent4: The photospheric boundary of the star seemed to shimmer with energy.
meanings.sent5: The photospheric layer of the sun is crucial for understanding its behavior.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the visible surface of a celestial body.
meanings.sent1: The photospheric features of the moon can be seen clearly with a telescope.
meanings.sent2: The photospheric details of the planet were captured in the telescope's images.
meanings.sent3: The photospheric view of the galaxy was breathtaking from the observatory.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with a photospheric glow under the starlit sky.
meanings.sent5: The photospheric appearance of the comet was a sight to behold in the night sky.
